result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A Krosinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant must maintain full-time employement.  Must not leave that employment without the approval of your probation agent.

The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.  If agent deems appropriate after assessments completed defendant must partitipate in Cognitive Group Intervention Program.  Must comply with any other recommendations of your agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail term is stayed if probation conditions successfully completed.  If jail term is imposed defendant may serve on Huber according to jail rules.  Credit for 3 days jail served.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: victim. Not to leave Jackson County unless approved by District Attorney's office first.  AMENDED 5/5/14: Defendant is to be at home between the hours of 8:00 pm and 6:00 am. AMENDED 5/12/2014: That the defendant be allowed to leave Jackson County and enter Trempealeau County for employment at Whitehall Specialties. Further, the defendant is permitted to leave his residence beginning at 4:00 AM on days in which he is scheduled to work at Whitehall Specialties at 5:00 AM. The defendant shall be required to return to Jackson County after his shift at Whitehall Specialties. The defendant shall still be required to be at his residence in Jackson County by 6:00 PM.
